</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Processes code when an [[Exception handling|exception]] is thrown in a [[try]] block. The exception caught can be found in the ''_exception'' variable. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> tryBlock [[catch]] code </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> tryBlock: [[Exception handling|Exception Type]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> code: [[Code]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Anything]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[try]] {[[throw]] "invalid argument"} [[catch]] {[[hint]] [[str]] _exception};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.53.133045</value></part></template>: <code>123 [[try]] {[[if]] (_this != 123) [[throw]] "invalid argument"} [[catch]] {[[hint]] [[str]] _exception};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> The correct usage of shorthand alt syntax: <code>[[try]] {
	[[if]] (a > b) [[throw]] "Error: some error"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>OK</value></part></template>
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>The command argument is static</value></part></template>
} [[catch]] {
	[[hint]] [[str]] _exception;
};

[[try]] {
	_someFunc = {
		.....
	};
	[[if]] (a > b) [[throw]] ([[call]] _someFunc); <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>NOT OK</value></part></template>
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>The command argument is dynamic</value></part></template>
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>_someFunc is called first to get the value regardless of (a > b) outcome</value></part></template>
} [[catch]] {
	[[hint]] [[str]] _exception;
};

[[try]] {
	_someFunc = {
		.....
	};
	[[if]] (a > b) [[then]] {[[throw]] ([[call]] _someFunc)}; /// OK
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>The command argument is dynamic</value></part></template>
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>_someFunc is only called when (a > b) is [[true]]</value></part></template>
} [[catch]] {
	[[hint]] [[str]] _exception;
};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[Exception handling]], [[try]], [[throw]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 
</value></part></template>
